segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Katherine, and today we are here with an advanced-level lesson.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们将进行一节高级课程。

segments.en: That means that we're going to listen to a pretty long and exciting dialogue, and then we'll talk a little bit about what you've heard and some of these cool, interesting phrases.
segments.cn: 这意味着我们将听一个相当长且激动人心的对话，然后我们会讨论一下你们听到的内容和一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we have a lesson about planning a crime or planning a bank robbery.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于策划犯罪或银行抢劫的课程。

segments.en: Ooh, my favorite.
There have been lots of movies about this topic, very fun movies.
segments.cn: 关于这个主题的电影很多，非常有趣。

segments.en: You know, from the beginning of movie-making till now, it's a very popular topic.
segments.cn: 从电影制作开始到现在，这一直是一个非常受欢迎的话题。

segments.en: That's right.

And on this occasion, as Katherine said, it's a nice, fun dialogue, and we're going to have a lot of colloquial terms, so maybe you won't really understand a couple of different phrases because they're very colloquial, they're very American terms.
segments.cn: 正如Katherine所说，这是一段有趣的对话，我们将会有很多口语用语，所以你可能不会理解一些短语，因为它们非常口语化，非常美国化。

segments.en: And the accents are also, they're a little bit from like Boston, kind of like New Jersey maybe or something.
segments.cn: 口音也有点像波士顿，可能像新泽西之类的。

segments.en: Right, so keep an ear out for some of these strange or unusual phrases.
segments.cn: 对，所以要留意一些奇怪或不寻常的短语。

segments.en: We will be talking about them in a moment.
But don't worry if you don't understand this dialogue the first time, you'll be hearing it again later.
segments.cn: 但如果你第一次听不懂这个对话也不用担心，稍后你会再听到。

segments.en: All right.
Let's run through this one more time from the top.
I will be positioned here, across from the bank on this park bench.
segments.cn: 我会坐在这里，坐在公园长椅上，面对银行。

segments.en: Now, according to the intel we got from Jimmy... Oh, who's Jimmy?
segments.cn: 根据我们从Jimmy那里得到的情报……哦，Jimmy是谁？

segments.en: Geez, Ralph, pay attention, will ya?
Jimmy's our mole, you know?
segments.cn: Jimmy是我们的内应，你知道吗？

segments.en: The guy on the inside?
He's been snooping and passing on the info to us so we can pull this heist off.
segments.cn: 他一直在偷听并把信息传给我们，以便我们能成功实施这次抢劫。

segments.en: Yeah, Ralph, clean the mothballs out of your ears and listen up.
segments.cn: 是的，Ralph，清理一下你的耳朵，听好了。

segments.en: This here's important.
We don't want to end up back in the slammer, do ya?
segments.cn: 我们可不想再进监狱，对吧？

segments.en: Your role is pretty important here, we're dependent on you, man.
segments.cn: 你的角色在这里很重要，我们依赖你，伙计。

segments.en: Okay, okay, I'm listening.
Mothballs.
All righty then.
Where was I?
Oh yeah, okay.
segments.cn: 所以我会在这里的长椅上观察，面对银行。

segments.en: So I'll be on the lookout, sitting here on the bench across from the bank.
segments.cn: 在我发出信号之前，谁都不许动，好吗？

segments.en: Nobody moves until I give the go-ahead, alright?
And what's the go-ahead, Ralph?
segments.cn: 你，呃……你，呃……哦，对了，你会脱下帽子，挠挠头。

segments.en: You, um... you, uh... oh yeah, you'll take off your hat and scratch your head.
Right.
segments.cn: 当我脱下帽子并挠头时，你要做什么？

segments.en: When I take my hat off and scratch my head, you do what?
I get in the box.
Right, you get in the box.
segments.cn: 我会确保它完全密封，然后假装成送货员，把一个特别的包裹送给经理。

segments.en: I'll make sure it's all sealed and then posing as the delivery guy, I'll drop off a special package for the manager.
segments.cn: 根据Jimmy的说法，银行经理星期二会提前离开，因为是他的结婚纪念日。

segments.en: Now, according to Jimmy, the bank manager's leaving early on Tuesday because it's his wedding anniversary.
segments.cn: 他和妻子在乡下享受浪漫约会，所以任何送到的包裹都会在他的办公室里未开封，直到他星期三晚些时候回来。

segments.en: He and the wife are having a romantic rendezvous in the country, so any packages delivered will be left unopened in his office until he gets back late on Wednesday.
segments.cn: 这给了我们至少12小时进入他办公室的机会。

segments.en: Which gives us access to his office for at least 12 hours.
Okay, Ralph, this is where you come in.
Where are you?
I'm standing right next to you, Sammy.
Oh, sorry, Sam.
segments.cn: 我在箱子里，就在这个箱子里。

segments.en: I'm in the box, right here, in that box.
segments.cn: 那么，一旦我把你送到经理办公室，你要做什么？

segments.en: And what do you do once I deliver you to the manager's office?
segments.cn: 我会待在箱子里，直到银行关门，然后我会从箱子里出来。

segments.en: I stay in the box until the bank is closed, and then I get out of the box.
And then?
What next, Ralph?
Oh, for Pete's sake, this is never going to work.
segments.cn: 嘿，给我一个机会，伙计们。

segments.en: Hey, give me a chance here, fellas.
segments.cn: 我打开保险箱，然后……然后我拿走钱，然后我再回到箱子里。

segments.en: I crack the safe and then... Then I take the money, and then I get back in the box.
Atta boy, Ralph.
segments.cn: 早上，我会回到银行，说我送的包裹出了问题，然后把特别的包裹带回来。

segments.en: In the morning, I come back to the bank, say there's been a mix-up with the delivery I made, and take the special package back here.
All right, let's get some sleep.
segments.cn: 明天是个大日子，伙计们。

segments.en: It's a big day tomorrow, fellas.
A perfect plan, Sammy.
It went off without a hitch.
segments.cn: 让我们打开这个，把Ralph弄出来，好开始数钱。

segments.en: Let's open this up and get Ralph out of here so we can start counting the money.
Phew, I sure am glad to see you guys.
segments.cn: 我一个人待着可真无聊。

segments.en: I was sure getting lonely with no one to talk.
That's nice.
Okay, how much?
Really?
Really, really, really glad.
Money, Ralph.
Money!
Oh, man.
I knew I forgot something.
All right, we're back.
So, obviously, this guy Ralph.
I don't know why.
segments.cn: 总是那个叫Ralph的抢劫犯不太聪明。

segments.en: Always the one robber whose name is Ralph is not very clever.
segments.cn: 不，这并不意味着Ralph一般都不聪明，但我想你说得对。

segments.en: No, it doesn't mean that Ralphs are generally not smart people, but yeah, I think you're right.
segments.cn: 通常……是的，比如在银行抢劫中。

segments.en: There's usually... Yeah, like in bank robberies or something.
segments.cn: 比如，在老电影中，总是Ralph搞砸事情。

segments.en: Like, for example, in the old movies, always Ralph was the one messing things up.
Oh, Ralph.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看今天Ralph搞砸了什么。

segments.en: Well, let's find out what Ralph screwed up today.
segments.cn: 首先，我们有Sammy、Ralph和Frankie在讨论计划。

segments.en: First of all, we've got the guys Sammy, Ralph, and Frankie who are talking about the plan.
Right.
segments.cn: Sammy提到他从Jimmy那里得到了情报。

segments.en: And Sammy mentions that he had the intel from Jimmy.
Okay.
segments.cn: 所以，当我们谈论情报时，我们是在谈论信息，对吧？

segments.en: So, when we talk about intel, we're talking about information, right?
That's right.
segments.cn: 所以，情报是一个缩写词，代表情报或事实或信息。

segments.en: So, intel is a word that's short for intelligence or facts or information.
That's right.
segments.cn: 所以，你可以谈论智力，可能你非常聪明，非常有智慧。

segments.en: So, you can talk about intelligence as maybe you're very smart, you're very intelligent.
segments.cn: 但当我们谈论情报时，我们是在谈论收集信息以帮助我们实现目标。

segments.en: But when we talk about intelligence, we talk about gathering information in order to help us accomplish an objective.
segments.cn: 例如，在关于CIA的电影中，我们经常听到他们谈论收集情报。

segments.en: For example, in movies about the CIA, we often hear them talk about gathering intel.
That means collecting facts.
Right.
Very good.
segments.cn: 所以，他们从Jimmy那里得到了关于银行和布局的情报。

segments.en: So, they had intel from Jimmy about the bank and the layout.
And, well, they were like, who's Jimmy?
segments.cn: 然后Sammy说，他是我们的内应，你知道吗？

segments.en: And Sammy says that, well, he's our mole, you know?
A mole.
So, a mole is an animal.
Right.
But in cases of intelligence, or maybe in this case a bank robbery, spying, a mole is a person who's basically stealing information.
segments.cn: 但在情报的情况下，或者在这个案例中，银行抢劫、间谍活动，鼹鼠是一个基本上在窃取信息的人。

segments.en: So, for example, if I work in the CIA, but I'm selling information from the CIA to the French government, I'm a mole.
segments.cn: 所以，例如，如果我在中央情报局工作，但我把情报卖给法国政府，我就是一个鼹鼠。

segments.en: Right.
So, you're basically like a spy.
segments.cn: 所以，你基本上就像一个间谍。

segments.en: Yes.
You're a person on the inside.
And that's what they mean when he says, he's our guy on the inside.
segments.cn: 这就是他所说的，他是我们内部的人。

segments.en: You're inside the enemy's territory, or you're inside their organization.
segments.cn: 你在敌人的领土内，或者在他们的组织内部。

segments.en: Exactly.
So, for example, have you seen the show 24?
segments.cn: 所以，例如，你看过《24小时》这个节目吗？

segments.en: Yeah, with Jack Bauer.
Well, they often have this problem of moles inside the organization.
segments.cn: 嗯，他们经常有内部鼹鼠的问题。

segments.en: So, maybe the terrorists have a guy on the inside.
segments.cn: 所以，也许恐怖分子有一个内部的人。

segments.en: That's right.
He's a mole.
So, they have somebody that has penetrated their organization.
segments.cn: 所以，他们有一个渗透了他们组织的人。

segments.en: Okay.
So, they talk about the mole and how they are going to pull this heist off.
segments.cn: 所以，他们谈论鼹鼠以及他们将如何实施这个抢劫。

segments.en: Okay.
So, the phrase here is to pull off a heist.
segments.cn: 所以，这里的短语是实施抢劫。

segments.en: First of all, what's a heist?
Well, a heist is a robbery, basically a robbery.
segments.cn: 嗯，抢劫基本上就是抢劫。

segments.en: Yeah.
It's another word for robbery.
segments.cn: 这是抢劫的另一种说法。

segments.en: It's kind of old, though.
You don't really say it anymore, right?
segments.cn: 你现在不太会说这个，对吧？

segments.en: No, you can say it's a heist movie or it's a movie about a heist.
segments.cn: 不，你可以说这是一个抢劫电影，或者这是关于抢劫的电影。

segments.en: It's almost like a genre.
You know, there's a basic storyline where they plan the robbery.
segments.cn: 你知道，有一个基本的故事情节，他们计划抢劫。

segments.en: They do the robbery.
Something goes wrong.
What's going to happen?
So, that's a heist.
Very good.
So, a heist is something that was planned out.
segments.cn: 所以，抢劫是经过计划的事情。

segments.en: Yes.
Like a robbery that's planned out.
segments.cn: 就像一个经过计划的抢劫。

segments.en: It's not really if you come up to someone and say, give me your wallet.
segments.cn: 如果你走到某人面前说，给我你的钱包，那就不算抢劫。

segments.en: That's not really a heist.
No, that's a stick up.
Right.
But a heist is something that you pull off.
segments.cn: 但抢劫是你成功实施的事情。

segments.en: So, to pull off is to succeed.
To accomplish.
To accomplish.
So, I pulled it off.
I was able to do it.
So, you pulled off the heist.
segments.cn: 所以，你成功实施了抢劫。

segments.en: Very good.
And, well, they were talking about if they do it, they don't want to get caught because they don't want to go back to the slammer.
segments.cn: 而且，他们在谈论如果他们这样做，他们不想被抓，因为他们不想回到监狱。

segments.en: The slammer.
Yeah, well, I don't blame them.
I wouldn't want to go to the slammer either.
So, what is the slammer?
The slammer.
The big house.
Right.
Lock up the slammer.
The big house.
All these are colloquial synonyms for prison.
segments.cn: 所有这些都是监狱的口语同义词。

segments.en: For jail.
Prison.
Jail.
So, normally we say prison or jail.
segments.cn: 所以，通常我们说监狱或监禁。

segments.en: Like it's a maximum security prison.
segments.cn: 就像是一个最高安全监狱。

segments.en: Like Prison Break, the TV show.
Right.
But, in colloquial English, we often say slammer.
segments.cn: 但是，在口语英语中，我们常常说监狱。

segments.en: Okay.
The slammer.
Or the big house.
Okay.
So, they were talking that they don't want to go back to the slammer.
segments.cn: 所以，他们在谈论他们不想回到监狱。

segments.en: And now, when they were actually planning out the crime, he says, well, you wait until I give you the go-ahead.
segments.cn: 现在，当他们实际上在计划犯罪时，他说，等我给你信号。

segments.en: Okay.
So, this is the plan.
He's going to wait for a sign.
The go-ahead means a sign that indicates that it's time to do something.
segments.cn: 信号意味着一个指示该做某事的信号。

segments.en: Okay.
So, for example, so in this case, what is that sign?
segments.cn: 所以，例如，在这种情况下，那个信号是什么？

segments.en: The sign or the go-ahead is he'll take off his hat and scratch his head.
segments.cn: 信号或信号是他会脱下帽子并挠头。

segments.en: Okay.
So, that's a sign that means it's okay to proceed.
segments.cn: 所以，那是一个表示可以继续的信号。

segments.en: It's okay to continue.
So, you can also say, okay, when we're ready to go, Marco, I'll give you the go-ahead.
segments.cn: 所以，你也可以说，好吧，当我们准备好时，马尔科，我会给你信号。

segments.en: Okay.
Just wait for me to wave.
Okay.
Very good.
So, that's the go-ahead.
The signal.
All right.
Very good.
Now, moving on, we have a French word here, but it's used very commonly in English.
segments.cn: 现在，继续，我们有一个法语单词，但在英语中使用得非常普遍。

segments.en: And they said, okay, we have a rendezvous.
segments.cn: 他们说，好吧，我们有一个约会。

segments.en: Okay.
So, a rendezvous is a meet-up or a time or place where people are connecting together.
segments.cn: 所以，约会是一个见面或人们聚集的时间或地点。

segments.en: So, for example, in a heist, you could say, we're going to Rob the bank, and then we will rendezvous at our favorite restaurant in two hours.
segments.cn: 例如，在一次抢劫中，你可以说，我们要抢银行，然后我们将在两个小时后在我们最喜欢的餐厅见面。

segments.en: Okay.
So, rendezvous is to meet up, to get together.
segments.cn: 所以，约会就是见面，聚在一起。

segments.en: Right.
But in this case, they're talking about a romantic rendezvous.
segments.cn: 但在这种情况下，他们谈论的是浪漫的约会。

segments.en: So, this means a trip with a lover.
segments.cn: 这意味着与爱人一起的旅行。

segments.en: Uh-huh.
So, it's a little bit different, right?
He and his wife are having a romantic rendezvous in the country.
segments.cn: 他和他的妻子在乡下进行浪漫的约会。

segments.en: Okay.
That means that they're going to have a romantic meeting.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们将有一个浪漫的会面。

segments.en: Uh -huh.
Okay.
Very good.
And now, this next phrase is very, very interesting.
segments.cn: 现在，这个下一个短语非常有趣。

segments.en: It's very common to hear it as well.
I think, like, moms say it a lot.
segments.cn: 我觉得，像妈妈们经常说。

segments.en: Oh, for Pete's sake.
Oh, for Pete's sake.
Well, I don't know who Pete is, honestly.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不知道皮特是谁，老实说。

segments.en: But this means, my gosh, or, come on, or, oh, I'm so tired of this.
segments.cn: 但这意味着，我的天，或者，拜托，或者，哦，我真是受够了。

segments.en: So, you're a little bit exasperated, maybe you're a little bit irritated.
segments.cn: 所以，你有点恼火，也许你有点烦躁。

segments.en: Oh, for Pete's sake, Marco, stop giving me examples.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，马尔科，别再给我举例子了。

segments.en: I'm done hearing them.
So, there are a lot of other ways to say this, right?
segments.cn: 所以，还有很多其他方式可以说这个，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
So, you could say, for goodness' sake.
For goodness' sake.
Or, oh, for heaven's sake.
For heaven's sake.
And finally, for God's sake.
Right.
But this one, you have to be careful, because some people who are religious might be offended if you use it.
segments.cn: 但这个，你得小心，因为一些宗教人士可能会对你使用它感到冒犯。

segments.en: So, if that's the case, then you would just rather go with Pete's sake, heaven's sake, or goodness' sake.
segments.cn: 所以，如果是这样的话，你宁愿用皮特的缘故，天的缘故，或者善良的缘故。

segments.en: Okay, for goodness' sake.
It's a very common phrase, and as you say, it's for when you're a little bit irritated.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的短语，正如你所说，它是当你有点恼火时使用的。

segments.en: It's like, oh, for goodness' sake, stop complaining.
segments.cn: 就像，哦，天哪，别再抱怨了。

segments.en: Exactly.
Right?
Okay.
And now, for our last word, you may have seen the word, fellas.
segments.cn: 现在，对于我们的最后一个词，你可能见过这个词，伙计们。

segments.en: Fellas.
Fellas.
So, this comes from the word fellow, person, man, but oftentimes in these kind of movies or stories about heists or, you know, crimes, the men talk to each other using the word fella or fellas.
segments.cn: 所以，这个词来自于同伴、个人、男人，但通常在这些关于抢劫或犯罪的电影或故事中，男人们用伙计或伙计们互相交谈。

segments.en: So, come on, fellas, let's go.
That means, come on, guys, come on, everyone.
segments.cn: 这意味着，来吧，伙计们，来吧，大家。

segments.en: Okay, yeah.
So, this is always about men, not like a group of women would use this.
segments.cn: 所以，这总是关于男人的，不像一群女人会使用这个。

segments.en: Right.
And it's something that's a little bit older.
segments.cn: 而且这是有点老旧的说法。

segments.en: We don't really say this like, oh, me and my fellas, we're going to go to the store.
segments.cn: 我们不再像这样说，哦，我和我的伙计们，我们要去商店。

segments.en: You would say this more in old-time English.
segments.cn: 你会在古老的英语中更多地说这个。

segments.en: Yeah, you can see it maybe in some movies when somebody comes up and greets other people, other guys.
segments.cn: 是的，你可能在一些电影中看到，当某人上前问候其他人，其他男人时。

segments.en: You would say, hey, fellas.
Exactly.
Or there's a mafia movie.
segments.cn: 或者有一部关于美国黑手党的电影叫《好家伙》。

segments.en: It's about the American mafia called Goodfellas.
Very good.
segments.cn: 这是一部非常著名的电影。

segments.en: It's a very famous one.
segments.cn: 它给你一种1940年代到1970年代的老英语的感觉。

segments.en: So, it kind of gives you that feeling of an older English like the 1940s to the 1970s.
Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 这个银行抢劫中发生了很多有趣的事情。

segments.en: A lot of interesting things going on in this bank robbery.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一遍对话，我们稍后会回来。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue one last time, and we'll be back in a little bit.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们从头再来一遍。

segments.en: Alright, let's run through this one more time from the top.
segments.cn: 我将站在这里，坐在银行对面的长椅上。

segments.en: I will be positioned here, across from the bank on this park bench.
segments.cn: 现在，根据我们从吉米那里得到的情报...

segments.en: Now, according to the intel we got from Jimmy...
Oh, who's Jimmy?
segments.cn: 天哪，拉尔夫，注意听，好吗？

segments.en: Jeez, Ralph, pay attention, will ya?
segments.cn: 吉米是我们的内应，你知道吗？

segments.en: Jimmy's our mole, you know?
The guy on the inside?
segments.cn: 他一直在窥探并向我们传递信息，以便我们能够完成这次抢劫。

segments.en: He's been snooping and passing on the info to us so we can pull this heist off.
segments.cn: 是的，拉尔夫，清理一下你耳朵里的虫蛀味，听好了。

segments.en: Yeah, Ralph, clean the mothballs out of your ears and listen up.
This here's important.
segments.cn: 我们可不想再回到监狱里，对吧？

segments.en: Your role is pretty important here.
segments.cn: 你的角色在这里非常重要。

segments.en: We're dependent on you, man.
Okay, okay, I'm listening, mothballs.
segments.cn: 好吧，好吧，我在听，虫蛀味。

segments.en: Alrighty then, where was I?
Oh yeah, okay.
So I'll be on the lookout, sitting here on the bench across from the bank.
segments.cn: 所以我会在这里的长椅上观察，坐在银行对面。

segments.en: Nobody moves until I give the go-ahead, alright?
segments.cn: 在我发出信号之前，谁都不能动，好吗？

segments.en: And what's the go-ahead, Ralph?
You, um... you, uh... Oh yeah, you'll take off your hat and scratch your head.
segments.cn: 你，呃...你，呃...哦，对了，你会脱下帽子，挠挠头。

segments.en: Right.
When I take my hat off and scratch my head, you do what?
segments.cn: 当我脱下帽子挠头时，你要做什么？

segments.en: I get in the box.
Right, you get in the box.
I'll make sure it's all sealed and then, posing as the delivery guy, I'll drop off a special package for the manager.
segments.cn: 我会确保一切都封好，然后假装成送货员，给经理送一个特别的包裹。

segments.en: Now according to Jimmy, the bank manager's leaving early on Tuesday because it's his wedding anniversary.
segments.cn: 根据吉米的说法，银行经理将在星期二早早离开，因为是他的结婚纪念日。

segments.en: He and the wife are having a romantic rendezvous in the country, so any packages delivered will be left unopened in his office until he gets back late on Wednesday.
segments.cn: 他和妻子在乡下进行浪漫的约会，所以任何送达的包裹将在他星期三晚些时候回来之前留在他的办公室里。

segments.en: Which gives us access to his office for at least 12 hours.
segments.cn: 这给了我们至少12小时进入他办公室的机会。

segments.en: Okay Ralph, this is where you come in.
segments.cn: 好的，拉尔夫，这就是你要参与的地方。

segments.en: Where are you?
I'm standing right next to you, Sammy.
Oh, sorry, Sam.
I'm in the box, right here, in that box.
And what do you do once I deliver you to the manager's office?
segments.cn: 一旦我把你送到经理办公室，你会做什么？

segments.en: I stay in the box until the bank is closed.
segments.cn: 我会待在箱子里，直到银行关门。

segments.en: And then I get out of the box.
segments.cn: 然后我会从箱子里出来。

segments.en: And then... what next, Ralph?
segments.cn: 然后……接下来是什么，拉尔夫？

segments.en: Oh, for Pete's sake, this is never going to work.
Hey, give me a chance here, fellas.
segments.cn: 嘿，给我一个机会，伙计们。

segments.en: I crack the safe and then... then I take the money... and then I... um... I get back in the box.
segments.cn: 我打开保险箱，然后……然后我拿走钱……然后我……呃……我再回到箱子里。

segments.en: Atta boy, Ralph.
In the morning I come back to the bank, say there's been a mix-up with the delivery I made, and take the special package back here.
segments.cn: 早上我回到银行，说我送的东西出了问题，然后把特别包裹带回来。

segments.en: Alright, let's get some sleep.
It's a big day tomorrow, fellas.
segments.cn: 明天是个大日子，伙计们。

segments.en: A perfect plan, Sammy.
It went off without a hitch.
Let's open this up and get Ralph out of here so we can start counting the money.
segments.cn: 让我们打开这个，把拉尔夫弄出来，这样我们就可以开始数钱了。

segments.en: Phew, I sure am glad to see you guys.
I was sure getting lonely with no one to talk.
segments.cn: 我一个人待着真是太孤单了。

segments.en: That's nice.
Okay, how much?
Uh, really?
Really, really, really glad.
Money, Ralph, money!
Oh, man.
I knew I forgot something.
Ahh!
Dammit.
Okay, so, someone proclaimed at the end of the dialogue that everything went off without a hitch.
segments.cn: 好吧，有人最后宣称一切顺利。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Is this true?
No.
What does it mean if something went without a hitch?
segments.cn: 如果某事顺利进行，这意味着什么？

segments.en: It went off without a hitch means there was not even one problem.
segments.cn: 一切顺利意味着没有任何问题。

segments.en: It went off, it went perfectly.
Smoothly.
Smoothly, yes.
And it didn't because, well, these robbers didn't actually Rob anyone.
segments.cn: 但实际上并没有，因为，这些劫匪并没有真正抢劫任何人。

segments.en: Right, he forgot to get the money.
Right, so he's kind of an idiot.
Right, but there are actually a lot of good movies.
segments.cn: 对，但实际上有很多好电影。

segments.en: I think the most recent one about bank robberies is Oceans 11, Oceans 12, Oceans 13.
segments.cn: 我认为最近关于银行抢劫的电影是《十一罗汉》、《十二罗汉》、《十三罗汉》。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right, those are all about big heists.
segments.cn: 是的，没错，那些都是关于大抢劫的。

segments.en: Big heists.
And I think they mentioned the word heist a couple of times in that movie.
segments.cn: 我认为他们在那部电影中提到“抢劫”这个词好几次。

segments.en: Yeah, definitely.
So there was a movie with Clive Owen a few years ago called The Inside Man that was maybe one of the best heist movies I've seen in a long time.
segments.cn: 几年前有一部克莱夫·欧文的电影叫《内部人士》，可能是我看过的最好抢劫电影之一。

segments.en: Yeah, that was a really good movie.
segments.cn: 是的，那是一部非常好的电影。

segments.en: I think also Swordfish was a pretty good movie with John Travolta.
segments.cn: 我认为《剑鱼》也是一部不错的电影，约翰·特拉沃尔塔主演。

segments.en: Yeah, I remember that one too.
Yeah, I like it when the bad guys win.
You know, because it's a little bit more interesting.
segments.cn: 你知道，因为这更有趣一点。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess you could say that.
segments.cn: 是的，我想你可以这么说。

segments.en: I don't think the public likes this.
segments.cn: 我觉得公众不喜欢这样。

segments.en: Well, in The Inside Man, the bad guy is kind of a good guy, but he wins.
segments.cn: 好吧，在《内部人士》中，坏人有点像好人，但他赢了。

segments.en: Uh -huh.
Yeah, I like that.
Yeah, but it's a very interesting topic and I don't know, I haven't really heard of many bank robberies nowadays anymore.
segments.cn: 是的，但这是一个非常有趣的话题，我不知道，现在我真的没有听说过很多银行抢劫。

segments.en: Not so much, I think security in banks is pretty good, but I'd be very curious to hear from our users if they have any favorite heist stories or movies, real or fake.
segments.cn: 不太多，我认为银行的安全性很好，但我很想听听我们的用户是否有任何喜欢的抢劫故事或电影，真实的或虚构的。

segments.en: Both are okay.
You can let us know on our website, EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 你可以在我们的网站上告诉我们，EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: That's right.
All right, we'll see everyone there.
Bye.
Bye.
